text:
Cornucopia boasts an all-star line-up on the Culinary Stage Published on : Thursday, October 15, 2015
Cornucopia, presented by BlueShore Financial, enters its 19th year in 2015, celebrating the people and places that produce incredible food and drink. Drawing inspiration from the Great White North, to the Mediterranean and everywhere in between – Cornucopia is plating up delicious and diverse cuisine at the Culinary Stage Series. With such a remarkable line-up, it’s no wonder anticipation is mounting for the annual food and wine extravaganza, taking place in Whistler from November 5-15.
Campbell River born Derek Dammann is the embodiment of working your way up the ladder. From humble beginnings Dammann worked his way to head chef and co-owner (with non-other than former boss, current friend and celebrity Chef Jamie Oliver) at the popular Maison Publique in Montreal.
Dammann and acclaimed Canadian food writer, Chris Johns joined forces to create True North: Canadian Cuisine from Coast to Coast. Launching November 3, the cookbook is as rugged and authentic as the land it celebrates. Of Dammann, Jaime Oliver writes, “Damn, that boy can cook. I really think he’s up there with some of the absolute best chefs in the word.” When asked what the audience can expect at the True North Culinary Stage? Dammann answered, “both Chris and myself are proud Canadians, so we’re really trying to showcase the beautiful ingredients this country has to offer through our eyes.” See Dammann and Johns at True North – where raw talent meets Canadiana grit.
Robbie Kane, owner of Vancouver hotspot Café Medina, joins the all-star guest list at Cornucopia’s Culinary Stage Series. Kane and Chef Deniz Tarakcioglu take guests on a behind-the-scenes glimpse at what makes the café’s signature Mediterranean-inspired cuisine one of the most in-demand stops on Vancouver’s bustling restaurant circuit. Boasting a number of accolades including, winner of Best Brunch and Best Breakfast at the 2015 Georgia Straight Golden Plate Awards, and named one of the Top 50 Restaurants in Canada 2015 by vacay.ca – Café Medina brings its gastronomic genius to Whistler for the Make Mine Mediterranean Culinary Stage Series, November 8.
For the sixth year running, Cornucopia’s much-loved Edible Canada will take to the Culinary Stage, featuring dishes that pair well with Canadian inspired cocktails. Join the informative lunch session on November 14, where Edible Canada President, Eric Pateman, and Chef de Cuisine, Alvin Pillay, prepare three dishes celebrating cultural influences from East, West and Central Canada, paired with expertly crafted cocktails. As always, the sessions will be filled with discussion and debate around what is Canadian cuisine, can it be defined, and what does the future hold? In true Edible Canada fashion, all dishes will be gluten free and somewhere, duck fat will be involved!
From commis to head chef, Dan Hayes, has worked with talented chefs in numerous high-end and Michelin starred restaurants. Now, Hayes and wife Micayla are the dynamic duo behind The London Chef – Micayla running the business, and Dan running the kitchen. Hayes has taught cookery all over the UK, has food-styled with one of Britain’s top food photography companies, and consulted on the development and opening of restaurants in London and the Canary Isles. Secure your seat at this must-see event, when The London Chef takes on Cornucopia’s Culinary Stage.
Dammann, Johns, Kane, Tarakcioglu, Pateman, Pillay and Hayes are just a taste of the high-calibre talent on the bill this Culinary Stage Series. But it doesn’t end there – be sure to secure your seat for the remaining all-star series, including: Pembytopia, Wine and Cheese with the Dairy Farmers of Canada, A Canape Party with Alligga and Master-Chef Alana Peckham, The Best of Lillooet, Beer and Cheese Workshop with the Dairy Farmers of Canada and Cicerone vs. Sommelier. Secure your seat when Whistler rolls out the culinary red carpet for the Culinary Stage Series, November 5-15.
